WorkItem.ClosedComment: The MySQL tools seem to stomp on the TypeScript Intellisense Provider; unfortunately there's nothing we can do about it on our side.
WorkItem.Description: Just upgraded from the previous alpha version and found that intellisense in Visual Studio no longer works for type script files. Compiling and error checking works seemingly better than in the previous alpha but intellisense does not start, neither when hitting "." or when forcing with CTRL+Space

Comments.Message:
Did some more digging and found a post of another person having the same problem. [http://rhnatiuk.wordpress.com/2013/03/08/typescripts-intellisense/](http://rhnatiuk.wordpress.com/2013/03/08/typescripts-intellisense/)

The issue appears to be connected with the MySQL tools. After removing them from Visual Studio, intellisense is working again. 
Still a little unhappy though, since I am actually using these MySQL tools, too. I guess now I have to install these tools whenever I need them and uninstall when I need typescript.
